tweet: Even with how much news we get every day, this one truly, deeply frustrates me.

Our military has a long history of remaining apolitical.

Not only is the President’s continued, public disdain for Sen. McCain unbecoming of the office, but his senior staff allowed it to politicize a military event to honor fallen servicemembers. https://nyti.ms/2XefNh1
I will do all I can to build on our common commitment to protecting our country and work to safeguard our political process.

I believe that Democrats and Republicans alike agree to their core that a foreign adversary should never be able to wage a disinformation campaign to sow discord in our communities and influence our elections.
But the objective need to safeguard our political system from foreign attack has unfortunately been lost in the partisan back-and-forth around the Mueller report.

The critical message Special Counsel Mueller reiterated today:

A foreign power made ‘multiple, systematic efforts to interfere in our election,’ particularly, as he noted, through the use of social media and disinformation tactics.

The report also lauds the efforts of state officials to tighten standards and test thoroughly in the face of EPA inaction. I commend our state officials who are working hard to clean up our water, and I will continue to push the EPA to do far more. We don't have time to waste.

We've known for some time in Michigan that PFAS was pervasive throughout our state – running out of our taps and flowing through our rivers. A report released yesterday identifies Michigan as having 192 PFAS-contaminated sites – the most in the country: https://bit.ly/2H5XR2x

The report also lauds the efforts of state officials to tighten standards and test thoroughly in the face of EPA inaction. I commend our state officials who are working hard to clean up our water, and I will continue to push the EPA to do far more. We don't have time to waste.
